[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/identity_information.rs] [Function: get_identity_information()] [Body Construction] Does Body::from() perform copying of the identity_information string, and could large responses cause memory duplication issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/identity_information.rs] [Function: handle_identity_information_request()] [Config Optimization Bypass] Does the ConfigOptimizer automatically enable expose_identity_information for non-mainnet chains, and could chain_id spoofing cause mainnet validators to leak identity information? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/identity_information.rs] [Function: handle_identity_information_request()] [Sanitizer Bypass] Does the ConfigSanitizer only check expose_configuration for mainnet validators but not expose_identity_information, allowing identity leaks even when configuration exposure is blocked? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/identity_information.rs] [Function: get_identity_information()] [Peer Discovery] Can the exposed peer IDs be used to impersonate or spoof connections to the validator, bypassing network authentication mechanisms? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/identity_information.rs] [Function: get_identity_information()] [Peer ID Collision] If two networks have colliding peer IDs due to implementation bugs, does the endpoint expose this inconsistency, or does it mask the security issue? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/identity_information.rs] [Function: get_identity_information()] [Identity Derivation] Since peer_id is derived from x25519 public keys using from_identity_public_key, does exposing peer IDs leak information about the underlying cryptographic keys?
